reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Improving living conditions of the most vulnerable population in Salqin, Hazano, Milis and Maaret Tamsrin through provision of shelter and winterization assistance.

description.narrative: BINAA will provide life-saving shelter improvement assistance to the most vulnerable IDP and HC HHs in Hazano, Salqin, Milis and Maaret Tamsrin communities in Idleb governorate. BINAA will Improved living conditions for conflict-affected IDP HHs though rehabilitating of 40unfinished buildings and moving IDP HHs to these buildings at an average of $845 for 500HHs (2,500individuals) (536men, 565women, 687boys and712 girls) as following: 15 Building in Milis (206 rooms) (65HHs already lives in the buildings and 141HHs will transfer them after complete the rehabilitation works) and 25 buildings in Maaret Tamsrin (294 Rooms) (76HHs already lives in the buildings and 218HHs will transfer them after complete the rehabilitation works BINAA will provide shelter repair and functional upgrades valued at an average of $650 for 375HHs (70%IDPs) (1,875individuals) (403men, 424women, 515boys, and 533girls) as following: 75in Hazano, 100in Salqin and 200 in Maaret Tamsrin. The repair works will be implemented through local contracting mythology and that will enable the target communities to use local materials and manpower to improve their living conditions, fostering a sense of ownership, responsibility, and resilience while supporting local markets. BINAA will provide emergency winter NFI assistance (Distribution of fuel for heating and heaters) for 875HHs (87%IDPs) (4,375 individuals) (987women, 938men, 1,247girls and1,203 boys) as following: 75 HHs in Hazano, 100HHs in Salqin, 206 HHs in Milis and 494in Maaret Tamsrin, the distribution of the fuel and heaters will be in kind using the e- distribution management system for better quality of the documentation. In total, BINAA will provide rehabilitation, upgrading of life-saving and sustaining shelter spaces and providing winter assistance to 875HHs (87%IDPs) (4,375 individuals) (987women,938 men, 1,247 girls and 1,203 boys). Beneficiaries numbers for the shelter unit’s rehabilitation calculated based on average number of HH members of 5 persons. Shelter repair beneficiaries will be IDP and HC HHs living in an inadequate shelter that does not meet minimum SPHERE minimum standards for square meters of covered living space per person and has inadequate privacy or protection from the elements, settlement planning and WASH facilities. We will target HHs that have light to medium damage but remain structurally sound. Works include doors and windows repair or replacement, partition installation, sealing cracks and holes in walls, and WASH facilities repairs. The works will ensure increased privacy between male and females, host and hosted families that enhance gender sensitive response. Furthermore, for HHs with disabled persons, additional works will be included to respond to their needs by including disability friendly entrance and toilet facilities (e.g. use of a simple ramp with a handrail for using wheelchairs at the building entrance and seating provisions for toilets). The unfinished buildings rehabilitation varies between the number of rooms in each unfinished building, installation of masonry partitions, repair of WASH facilities within the building. To enhance gender sensitive response, necessary adaptations that particularly affect women and girls will include appropriate lighting, separate toilets and showers for men and women, accessible facilities for people with disabilities (disability friendly entrance and toilet facilities), areas for bathing, washing of clothing, and partitions to create spaces for different households and additional partitions within households to create privacy for men and women. To participate in the project HHs and building owners should agree on the terms of assistance and sign a contract that allows the IDP household to stay for one year for free to ensure that HLP guidance are considered and utilized. To benefit from the project, all beneficiaries should present valid HLP documents that verify the ownership of properties.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
